meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>cool</kanji> (temperature-wise) and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to cool oneself</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to cool off</vocabulary>. Whoo, that feels much cooler now.
readingMnemonic:
The reading is the kun'yomi reading, but that's the reading you learned with the kanji so you should be able to read this one too. 

If you need a refresher, remember that the <reading>Sue Zoo</reading> (すず) was made for the penguin Sue <vocabulary>to cool off</vocabulary> in, even when it's hot outside.
